column4: Anyone able to help me figure out why I can't connect to my Airport Extreme-based wireless network on 9.10?
WEP or WPA?
Neither, just a plain old open network.
hmmm
worked in earlier version of ubuntu?
bcm4306 card, 5-year-old hp laptop, b43-fwcutter installed.
I've not used the laptop in a year and a half; It was in various states of working and not working prior to that for its entire life.
hmmm, odd ... network-manager?
Let me go retrieve the laptop from upstairs.  Sorry, left it up there.  Just a min.

OK, laptop retrieved.  It was upstairs because that's where the wired connection is.  But down here, I have wireless working (on this computer, not the laptop), so any notes will have to be hand-copied from the other screen
That aside.......What do you want/need to know?
what happens when you try to connect
ifdown wlan0; ifup wlan0
so you aren't using network-manager or wifi-radar?
Never heard of wifi-radar, and I believe I've tried network-manager to no avail.
Heh.  Remember that part about the network being upstairs?
Any command-line incantations you're aware of that might help?
I'm 100% comfortable at the CLI
No ideas about CLI incantations?  No network connection means no downloading wifi-radar
I've gotta run out .. but I'd suggest going through this https://help.ubuntu.com/community/WifiDocs/WiFiHowTo
Thanks.  I'll peruse it
